Pre-Game Insights: France had a disappointing start to the Nations League campaign and will hope to find better luck on Monday.
Belgium’s national football team, meanwhile, secured a 3-1 win over Israel as Kevin de Bruyne’s double helped the side to a perfect start to the Nations League campaign.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kylian Mbappe’s first game at the international level as a Real Madrid player ended in a disappointing 3-1 loss at home to Italy.
Kevin de Bruyne netted a brace to lead Belgium to a 3-1 win over Israel in their opening game of the Nations League.
Others: The two sides have faced off only 76 times in the past, with Belgium winning 30 of those games.
France will be determined to bounce back on home soil, with Didier Deschamps’ seventh major tournament as manager of the French side.
